entry.title: Prerender: Use "use_prefetch" on PrerenderOmniboxSearchSuggestionBrowserTest
entry.content:
Now the default "implementation_type" of prerendering for default

search engine is "use_prefetch" but the tests still use legacy

"ignore_prefetch". This CL fixes them.



Notes

- This CL makes SearchPrefetchService become friend with

PrerenderOmniboxSearchSuggestionBrowserTest so that the test can call

SearchPrefetchService::CoordinatePrefetchWithPrerender() to expire

prerendering. For the same reason, this chanegs the scope of anonymous

namespace in the test file.

- This CL removes UpdateHistoryBeforeActivation() as the new

implementation doesn't need to update a displayed URL after on

activation.



Bug: 1485775

Change-Id: I3d017909bd6b8fbd14381df2e3f911d54e7afd67

entry.title: Revert "[headless] Cleaned up min/max/restore operations on Linux"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6f75d18ee6ccab37c38c1b28bdc84b451ec8050e.



Reason for revert:

HeadlessModeProtocolBrowserTest.MinimizeRestoreWindow is constantly

failing on Mac11 bot:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/21464/overview



Original change's description:

> [headless] Cleaned up min/max/restore operations on Linux

>

> When new headless browser window is being minimized, maximized and

> restored by CDP Browser.setWindowBounds() the window size and

> state is not changed as expected.

>

> The reason for this is that on Linux new headless uses extremely

> basic ui::HeadlessWindow which is based on ui::StubWindow.

>

> This CL provides a more elaborate implementation of ui::HeadlessWindow

> that supports most of the standard window operations, including

> min/max/restore.

>

> Drive by: it also fixes Browser.setWindowBounds({windowState:'normal'})

> problem which restores minimized window visibility but leaves the

> window in minimized state.

>

> Bug: 1485920

> Change-Id: Ic2181619b5715251120328c0e266afe1c5530a24

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4895065

> Reviewed-by: Michael Spang

> Reviewed-by: Andrey Kosyakov

> Commit-Queue: Peter Kvitek

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1202874}



Bug: 1485920

Change-Id: I8bfea97d91b21b5b0fdba94f8411faf78daa86ff

entry.title: [Shortcut] Do not auto update for shortcut with no manifest.
entry.content:
When we turn on the flag to CreateShortcutIgnoresManifest, we should

stop auto update the shortcut, otherwise it will get the manifest

and upgrade itself to a web app if the start url is the same.



This is essential for Chrome OS because we are introducing different

UI for shortcuts. However, it also seems to make sense to stop

the update for other platforms becuase if we want to be able to

create shortcut ignores manifest, we should not update the app to

use the manifest soon after. However I'm happy to only change this

for Chrome OS if we decide to not update this for WML.



BUG=1412708



Change-Id: I0d2468ceccb6dc63fd538b07b58df0d8e1f0fc45

entry.title: snap-groups: Implement auto-snap for clamshell
entry.content:
In Snap Groups clamshell mode, windows will be auto-snapped, i.e. from

shelf, when split view overview session is active. This moves the

creation of AutoSnapController to SplitViewController for tablet mode, and SplitViewOverviewSession for clamshell mode.



This is needed so that we can move `StartOverview()` on window snapped

to SnapGroupController.



Note that AutoSnapController will snap via `WindowState::OnWMEvent()`

and not `SplitViewController::SnapWindow()` to support multiple snap groups.



Fixed: b/298265541

Test: SnapGroupEntryPointArm1Test.AutoSnapOneWindow

Change-Id: Ied26a1f474949b3f1e5ec9dba846f200d0185f50

entry.content:

protocol. This is for cases when a failure occurs outside of the scope

of the test being run, e.g. there's a failure to parse the given query

correctly.

entry.title: media: Log when Clear Lead video switches from clear to encrypted buffer
entry.content:
This CL logs to Media Log when a stream processed through

MediaFoundation switches for unencrypted frames to encrypted frames

for streams with clear lead.



Tested by playing an HEVC ClearLead playback on Integration Console.

1. Verified Chrome used MediaFoundationRenderer.

2. Verified Chrome printed in Media Log:

"Stream switched from clear to encrypted buffers.".



In the Media Log during testing:

pre 10 seconds: did not say anything in media log.

post 10 seconds: printed the "stream switched from clear to

encrypted buffers."

entry.title: Remove 'corruption detected' warnings if it's ignored anyway
entry.content:
These `corruption detected in extension` warning show up in the

syslog all the time, but they are really harmless if all that's

happening is that the hashes are missing (and that the code decides

not to enforce hashes).



So I moved this warning to after the check that decides to ignore it.



This makes it much easier to spot if there actually *is* a corruption

that needs to be handled.



Bug: N/A

entry.title: Robolectric: Load native libraries via test runner
entry.content:
Whether or not native is loaded is a global one-way switch, so it will

reduce a source of flakiness by loading it at a consistent point (right

off the bat), and remove the need for tests to worry about whether or

not it is loaded.

entry.title: [Autofill] Represent FormFieldData::form_control_type as enum
entry.content:
This CL changes the type of FormFieldData::form_control_type from

std::string to an enum. The goal of this CL and its followup CLs is

give us a better understanding which code handles which form control

types.



For now, due to the huge number of references, this CL converts

occurrences like

field.form_control_type == "text"

to

field.form_control_type == StringToFormControlType("text")

and occurrences of the form

Foo(field.form_control_type)

to

Foo(FormControlTypeToString(field.form_control_type)).



Followup CLs will propagate the type conversion where possible. The

conversions to/from strings will remain at least for a while in a

few cases:

- Form- and field signatures: signatures compute a hash that includes

the form control type as string. We will migrate this to the enum

slowly.

- FormFieldData serialization: Password Manager serializes many

FormFieldData attributes. We should understand what is actually

needed (crbug.com/1353392).

- Logging like chrome://autofill-internals.



Bug: 1482526, 1484810

Change-Id: I231121127483d6f30f1216247d71b3aa07853ef3

entry.title: Add support for multiple render passes in DCLayerOverlayProcessor
entry.content:
DCLayerOverlayProcessor only supports one render pass. This is primarily

due to storing the previous frame's overlays to optimize the damage

rect. This change adds support for processing multiple render passes by

storing the previous frame's overlays for each render pass.



In addition, DCLayerOverlayProcessor limits the total number of overlays

in an entire frame based on hardware MPO support. This number is stored

as allowed_yuv_overlay_count_. In order to not exceed this maximum

allowed number of overlays, we need to know how many total overlays

exist across all render passes. DCLayerOverlayProcessor::Process is

refactored to collect all candidates for all render passes first, and

then promote them if the total number of overlays do not exceed the

maximum allowed.



Bug: 1416994

Change-Id: Id92c033e6d0569f5c89e32b59bf15d7c76cbb0d0

entry.title: Let PLSA::UsesCompositedScrolling() use the current compositing status
entry.content:
This makes it always use the CompositeScrollAfterPaint way for the

function. This prepares for removing pre-CompositeScrollAfterPaint

code. It's safe to do it now because the function is used in only

two places where the risk of breakage is low:

1. ScrollableArea/PLSA, to show non-composited overlay scrollbars.

2. Animation, to check if we can start a scroll-driven animation

in the compositor, behind a flag ScrollTimelineOnCompositor.



For 1, now we will show overlay scrollbar in the main thread iff

the scrollbar is currently composited, which is more accurate.

The change also fixes potential bug that in CompositeScrollAfterPaint

we may show scrollbars unnecessarily because of the previous check

for NeedsCompositedScrolling which only returns true if the scroller

is forced to be composited in CompositeScrollAfterPaint.



For 2, the new code is more accurate, if there is any change.

We may also remove the check soon because we are already allowing

composited scroll-driven animation in cc (https://crrev.com/1136319).



Bug: 1414885

Change-Id: Ied719dd5438651d65eb8bfecd471455fcc06d6a3

entry.title: Guard HLS fallback code with HLS buildflag
entry.content:
Much of the code to support HLS playback via FFMpeg fallback was guarded

behind IS_ANDROID instead of the more logical ENABLE_HLS_DEMUXER.

Switching to the HLS specific flag (only turned on by default in

android) allows building the HLS code optionally on desktop.

entry.title: settings: Add support for null top row descriptor in keyboards
entry.content:
The null value "C0000" is used by keyboard manufacturers in the top row

descriptor to denote that the keyboard is opting out of the meta + f-key

rewrites setting. That functionality will come in a later CL. However,

all devices with this property also have a capslock key. This CL allows

the capslock key to be remapped on these devices and adds initial logic

to identify this case.



Bug: b/301685846

entry.title: [Build] Create Trichrome32.ssargs; add more *_32_* targets.
entry.content:
This CL continues crrev.com/c/4847552, and add more explicit 32-bit

targets to help with android-binary-size bot's transition to 64-bit.

Details:

* Add Trichrome32.ssargs, which is intended to be used for binary

size monitoring when android-binary-size bot moves to 64-bit.

* Selects 32-bit abi_filter explicitly.

* Change to symbol_dir.

* Add required targets (noting trichrome_library_32_apk exists):

trichrome_webview_32_minimal_apks

trichrome_chrome_32_minimal_apks

* Add targets for symmetry:

monochrome_32_public_minimal_apks

resource_sizes_monochrome_32_public_minimal_apks

* Parameterize targets

resource_sizes_trichrome

resource_size_config_trichrome

to accommodate 32-bit builds (keep old behavior) and 64-bit builds:

* Use _*_for_size local variables to parameterize.

* Change trichrome_chrome_minimal_apks to 32-bit build only

* Replace trichrome_minimal_apks with trichrome_32_minimal_apks.

* For 64-bit: (use *_32_* targets and *32.* artifacts)

* Use new target trichrome_chrome_32_minimal_apks.

* Use *32.* artifacts.

* Use Trichrome32.ssargs.

* Use different symbol_dir.



Bug: 1414410

Change-Id: Ibe1a76a96159a4f5f3e80d3c18cf05f82e6f5403

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4901342

Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

Reviewed-by: Richard (Torne) Coles

Commit-Queue: Samuel Huang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1202984}

entry.title: Add emergency off-switch for GetNetworkConnectivityHint API
entry.content:
A previous CL added the call to GetNetworkConnectivityHint on

modern Windows systems, in order to function correctly inside

the sandbox.



This call makes subtle changes to the behavior of the network

change notifier, in particular it results in fewer incorrect

detections of online state, and more correct detections of

offline state.



As a precaution, place this new API call behind an

enabled-by-default emergency off-switch, just in case this has

any unexpected effects once it reaches Stable channel.



This CL contains no function change, since the feature is

enabled by default.



BUG=1450754



Change-Id: I529bea07ee0a0a941574c04e0c2ca9440b72e33b

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global one.""
entry.content:
This reverts commit c28d46e9d76da6a33a8109afc49a86dbe8a0c82c.



Reason for revert: This change introduces a bug (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1485381). I will create a design doc to discuss how we can make the reading mode side panel local without causing this problem.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global one."

>

> This is a reland of commit d5dacbd5bc28d84bbe948719c9f47e91465502ac

>

> The original CL was reverted because it failed linux-chromeos-chrome. In

> that failed builder, read_anything_toolbar_view_browsertest crashed

> unexpected when initializing a ReadAnythingCoordinator in the

> SetUpOnMainThread method (line 62). The crash happened in the

> ReadAnythingCoordinator constructor when it called

> CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents, a new method I added to

> register existing web contents (tabs) to Read Anything Side panel (line

> 58 in read_anything_coordinator.cc in the original CL). In my update, I

> removed this line as well as the

> CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents method. This method is

> unnecessary because an existing tab will be registered to Read Anything

> side panel whenever we switch to that tab in

> ReadAnythingCoordinator::OnTabStripModelChanged. After this change,

> linux-chromeos-chrome passed and the Read Anything local side panel

> still worked correctly.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global

> > one.

> >

> > Bug: 1439905

> > Change-Id: Icdcabd2ddade61c4a32805c9a41668d621993aef

entry.title: Files app: Convert list_item to TS
entry.content:
Steps to convert cr.ui elementst to TS:



1. Instead of `crUiDefine()` use a factory function that instantiates

a native element and decorates it with the cr.ui element's

implementation. See `createListItem()` in this CL.



2. Instead of `Object.defineProperty()`, inline the actual getter and

setter, use the `getSetter*()` to keep the same behaviour: only

setting the value when actually changing and dispatching the

"${attr}Change" event.



NOTE: The setter function is called 2x, once

for TS to recognize the type and put in the constructor and again in

the decorate(), which is the initialization since the constructor

isn't called.



3. Put the initialization and default values in the decorate().



Bug: b:289003444

Change-Id: Ida9e5be10381580c5e3e6d73d2bec47838d467d3

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4893435

entry.title: Abort all MultiBufferDataSource before deleting
entry.content:
The previous teardown logic only aborted MultiBufferDataSource

implementations which were waiting for an outstanding read to complete,

but MultiBufferDataSource will continue to update it's buffers in the

background even after a read is completed. Because these MBDS instances

were still downloading without being aborted, the deletion of

BufferedDataSourceHostImpl was causing a UAF.



Bug: 1478104

entry.title: [a11y] Fix screen reader experience in Omnibox to match Stable
entry.content:
The omnibox text exposed to screen readers was cached and not cleared

when after an update, leading to a terrible screen reader experience in

Canary.



For example, typing "hello world" in the omnibox would often cache the

first character only, and make the screen reader announce "h" in

response to some user action (depending on which API was used).



To fix this, we now clear the computed data whenever we're refetching

accessible data from Views. This was already the behavior before I

started working in that area (we were creating a new temporary AXNode

all the time), so there should be no performance impact.



Eventually, once the ViewsAX project will be completed, we'll be

able to rely on the caching/cache clearing system already implemented

in AXTree::Unserialize, which will improve performance.



Fixed: 1485365

Change-Id: Ie46b730270a2e5643138651be5c3c620b0f2db6d

entry.title: view-transition: Refactor script state out of ViewTransition
entry.content:
With the addition of the beforefirstrender event, ViewTransition will be

exposed to script from a new API surface but will require a new

interface, since the updateCallbackDone promise isn't relevant in the

cross-document case. Additionally, in the cross-document case,

ScriptState isn't available up-front like it is in the

`startViewTransition` case. In fact, the ViewTransition object may now

be exposed to multiple ScriptStates (e.g. extension content scripts can

register a handler for `beforefirstrender` and access the same

ViewTransition object.).



This will make the IDL implementation and script context handling a bit

more complicated. To make this more straightforward, this CL prepares

for the above by factoring out the script-interacting bits of

ViewTransition (the C++ object) into a separate class,

DOMViewTransition. I've tried to keep this a simple move where possible;

there shouldn't be any behavior changes.



https://crrev.com/4831913 will add a new IDL interface for the

cross-document case and use DOMViewTransition as its implementation.



Bug: 1466250

Change-Id: I3bbd37d936646ebd80008c6f8b018af376f61cf1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4818049

Reviewed-by: Vladimir Levin

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

entry.title: Prevent unnecessary SR histogram lookup
entry.content:
Rework of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4341694.



When merging a histogram from an allocator (e.g. from a PMA file or

child process) with the StatisticsRecorder (SR) histogram, we

currently *always* lookup the SR histogram, even if the histogram to

be merged is "empty" (has no new samples). This CL avoids the lookup

(and hence the lock acquisition) when the histogram is empty (i.e.,

no new samples since the last "delta snapshot"), to hopefully reduce

contention.



--



Some technical details that I think will help reviewing this:

"HistogramSamples" is the base class (interface) for a container of

samples. Some implementations are backed by a file, which is what

histograms use (PersistentSampleVector for numeric histograms,

PersistentSampleMap for sparse histograms) to store their samples.

When calling SnapshotDelta() on those histograms, the returned

samples are stored in non-persistent implementations (SampleVector for

numeric histograms, SampleMap for sparse histograms).



This CL adds an efficient "IsDefinitelyEmpty()" function to the

various child classes of HistogramSamples. It is efficient because it

does not loop through the underlying container to see if there are

samples. As a result, however, this does not always return the correct

result, and so should not be used generally. However, for our

purposes, this should be fine, because:

- 1) IsDefinitelyEmpty() may incorrectly return "false", but will not

incorrectly return "true" (no false positives). This assumes

however that the container it is being called on is being

handled in a "single-threaded" manner.

- 2) In this CL, we only call IsDefinitelyEmpty() on the results of

SnapshotDelta(), which is a special case and pretty much always

returns the correct result, since the returned HistogramSamples

is not manipulated concurrently, and is generally unmodified

once created.



Bug: 1123627

Change-Id: I3660c3b5a9cdb9a6c75e147cc1fd74247924c7d8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4897156

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Commit-Queue: Luc Nguyen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1202941}

entry.title: Enable GWP-ASan on Windows arm64
entry.content:
GWP-ASan was enabled only on Windows x64 because x86 has a limited

amount of virtual address space, which upped the number of inactionable

reports (https://crbug.com/969146).



However there's no reason why it can't be enabled on Windows arm64 as

it's only 32-bit CPUs that are limited in virtual address space.

entry.title: Implement ClampRound() using std::round().
entry.content:
Calling standard library functions is safer, and frequently faster,

than home-grown rounding code. This also fixes a bug where certain

values very close to 0.5 would be rounded the wrong way.



Also document more clearly what the rounding behavior of these

functions are.

entry.title: [Mac Sonoma Tests] Work around hang when reusing NSMenus
entry.content:
The MenuRunnerImplCocoa owns a menu controller which it reuses to

display a (native) NSMenu. Back-to-back sequences of presenting the

NSMenu and then cancelling it from within menuWillAppear: lead to a

hang on macOS 14.



This cl changes MenuRunnerImplCocoa to regenerate its menu controller,

leading to a fresh NSMenu on each menu presentation request.



Test: out/Debug/views_unittests \

--gtest_filter="MenuRunnerCocoaTest.ComboboxAnchoring/NATIVE_NSMenu"



Bug: 1486925

entry.title: [Cast] Avoid old Android IPC used to check for key system support
entry.content:
Previously each renderer on Android would check for key system support

by using cdm::QueryKeySystemSupport(), which uses the old IPC protocol.

New way is to use the KeySystemSupport mojo interface where key

systems are registered in the browser, and renderers subscribe to

notifications. This matches what is being done for desktop browsers

(and Chrome on Android).



KeySystemSupport allows for delayed determination of what features are

supported until the first time it is queried. So registration in the

browser is done without specifying any capabilities, and they will be

computed the first time they are needed.



Bug: 853336

Change-Id: Icd4b10f3c45e9c9cf48de19b09bb15ac1ff861bc

entry.content:
CT enforcement is required for all publicly trusted certificates since

anymore, so we can require it unconditionally now.

entry.title: immersive fs mac: ensure that the overlay widget is observed only once
entry.content:
The overlay widget is observed twice and causes DCHECK failure in UI

devtools because both the overlay widget's own NSWindow and AppKit's

native NSToolbarFullScreenWindow maps to the overlay widget. See

https://crrev.com/c/3750424.



This CL fixes the DCHECK failure by ensuring each widget is observed

only once in UI devtools.

entry.title: Make use-fake-device-for-media-stream work with WebSpeech.
entry.content:
SpeechRecognitionManagerImpl is already correctly checking with

MediaStreamManager that a fake device is available. However

SpeechRecognizerImpl was querying the AudioSystem to get the

AudioParameters instead of using the ones provided by the

MediaStreamManager.



We could fix this by having SpeechRecognitionManagerImpl inject

the AudioParameters into SpeechRecognizerImpl, but this runs a

slight risk of parameter mismatch in production. It's unlikely

to be a real issue, but this code is old so err on the side of

caution.



Instead, since we know there should be an active device by this

point, just use AudioParameters::UnavailableDeviceParams() when

invalid device parameters are returned by the AudioManager.



If there really isn't a device, this will just fail with the

same type of capture error that we had previously. This limits

any production fallout to WebSpeech working in slightly more

situations instead of less.



Bug: b/257278673

Change-Id: I19b888aa1109276277d3797fe0854aed3772b604

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4894761

entry.title: Make dir=auto fall back to the parent's directionality rather than ltr.
entry.content:
When dir=auto fails to find text with strong directionality (or a

element) to determine the directionality of the element, it should fall

back to the directionality that it would have inherited from its parent

(or, for , its shadow host) rather than falling back to ltr.



This requires updating directionality invalidation to account for the

possibility that elements with dir=auto can inherit directionality.



This is based on the proposed behavior described in:

https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3699#issuecomment-951423468

which is in the process of being specified in:

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9554

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9796



This is one of two changes needed to fix the failure of:

external/wpt/html/dom/elements/global-attributes/dir-shadow-41.html

in the still-unlanded WPT PR at

https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/29820



Bug: 576815

Change-Id: I9fc7c85875074ad41704ab45ec70c7632c3f8d31

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4805163

Commit-Queue: David Baron

entry.title: Reland "Add ScopedGSignal for managing GLib signal lifetime"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 15eaed5fd66be5a76ea620b08ab08ad5e6e1d712



The reland fixes CFI tests, and adds 2 changes I noticed while

converting signal usage in //ui/gtk to ScopedGSignal:

1. Adds missing return in callback function

2. Adds a raw_ptr constructor overload



Original change's description:

> Add ScopedGSignal for managing GLib signal lifetime

>

> Currently, g_signal_connect() is used in //remoting, //ui/gtk,

> //net //third_party/webrtc, and //content/browser/accessibility.

> In almost all cases, the signal isn't disconnected when receiving

> objects are destroyed, which can lead to use-after-frees.

>

> This CL adds ScopedGSignal for safer management of GLib signal

> lifetime since proper management of GLib signals is surprisingly

> tricky: g_signal_handler_disconnect() should be called when the

> signal is no longer needed, but if the sender is deallocated

> before disconnecting, a crash will occur in GLib. Therefore we

> also need to listen for sender destruction. However, this

> creates some more problems since GLib may run the destruction

> callback asynchronously after we've disconnected from the signal,

> so we also need to carefully remove the destruction callback

> in the appropriate places.

>

> Followup CLs will convert usages of g_signal_connect() to

> ScopedGSignal, and a presubmit check will be added to prevent

> new usages of g_signal_connect().

>

> Change-Id: I485a188c915ea79910dad181eddda5eed075e9c0

entry.title: [headless] Cleaned up min/max/restore operations on Linux
entry.content:
When new headless browser window is being minimized, maximized and

restored by CDP Browser.setWindowBounds() the window size and

state is not changed as expected.



The reason for this is that on Linux new headless uses extremely

basic ui::HeadlessWindow which is based on ui::StubWindow.



This CL provides a more elaborate implementation of ui::HeadlessWindow

that supports most of the standard window operations, including

min/max/restore.



Drive by: it also fixes Browser.setWindowBounds({windowState:'normal'})

problem which restores minimized window visibility but leaves the

window in minimized state.

entry.title: Fully ship early process singleton
entry.content:
This CL is shipping by default the early process singleton

experiment.



Previously, the process singleton was taken after the

creation of the BrowserProcessImpl and was not covering all the

accesses to Chrome user-data-dir (a.k.a prefs).



The new early implementation is lifting the scope of the singleton

into ChromeMainDelegate class. This is simplifying the logic around

what is covered by the singleton.



There will be no BrowserProcessImpl(...) unless the process own the

singleton.

entry.title: Dedupe setBookmarks.
entry.content:
The BookmarkManagerMediator is unable to selectively apply most model

updates to the list of items. So it refreshes the entire UI. This is

already somewhat expensive, but if multiple events come from the model

in quick succession, such as the deletion/moving of many items, then

the UI thread locks up and we get an ANR.



To mitigate this, any model event that would result in a full refresh

is instead posted to be run asynchronously. This allows multiple

sequential model updates to be deduped into a just a single refresh,

hopefully reducing the number of ANRs this UI surface sees

significantly.



Bug: 1481191, 1487638

Change-Id: I69d927dbc32392ded1cd0cdbbc78304044967a81

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4885465

entry.title: Add automatic beacon histograms.
entry.content:
To better assist in debugging a discrepancy we're noticing between

reports from existing click reporting APIs and the

`reserved.top_navigation` automatic beacon API, we are adding metrics

to get a better sense of why some clicks are not resulting in automatic

beacons being sent out.



This CL adds a histogram to log the outcome of an attempt to send an

automatic beacon. It tracks if the beacon is successfully passed off to

the `SendFencedFrameReportingBeaconInternal()` function, or if it was

not passed due to one of the following reasons:

- There was no transient user activation when the top-level navigation

happened.

- There was no automatic beacon information in place.

- The frame initiating the top-level navigation is not same-origin to

the mapped url in the fenced frame properties.

- No destinations were registered in the automatic beacon info.



This CL adds histograms to log if a top-level navigation originating

from a fenced frame is started, as well as if it commits. This is being

added to see if there is a percentage of top-level navigations that

originate from a fenced frame that result in some sort of failure (such

as a 404, a timeout, or the load being blocked by a content blocker).



Change-Id: Ie24ee3a2b0e3d98e10fbd5844b85f024fd363d32

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4877250

Reviewed-by: Garrett Tanzer

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Chris Thompson

Commit-Queue: Liam Brady

entry.title: [ChromeVox] Get bounds from Automation, supporting browser_tests_require_lacros
entry.content:
Rather than getting bounds for web contents elements by

injecting JS into the web contents itself, this change

stands up an automation helper which gets bounds using

the automation API. This allows bounds to be retrieved

for nodes outside of Ash, namely Lacros.



The automation helper injects a small Javascript

support file into the extension background page and

can call methods in Javascript and wait for their

return, parse the result, and send it back to the

caller.



Also makes a method of html_test_utils private since

no other classes depend on it. In a follow-up I hope

to fully deprecate html_test_utils in favor of the

new automation test utils.
